topics.body:
One main problem with the chickenosaur project is that Jack Horner wants his creation to have teeth. However, although chickens have been known to develop first-generation archosaur teeth as embryos, this is caused by a lethal allele known as talpid2. Also, the teeth do not have enamel or dentin, as there are no longer any functional enamel or dentin genes in the chicken genome, only non-functional pseudogenes. This is a big hurdle, but there are two steps that could be done to overcome this:

1. Either borrow enamel and dentin genes from crocodilians to replace the non-functional versions of these genes in chickens, or try to change the chicken's genes so that they are functional again.
2. Try restricting talpid2 expression to the chicken embryo's jaws/mouth (the reason why talpid2 is usually lethal is because it affects organ systems and limbs).

The second one would require some good research and experimenting, though.

topics.body:
For some odd reason I'm starting to like ponies and furries again. . . . . *WAIT!* Let me explain; you know that feeling of when you are with a group of people on something and you get frustrated to the point you just say, "fuck it" and walk off only to later on realize you didn't actually hate the thing you were with them with and just hated being around those people?  That's the feeling I'm having right now.


The breaking point for me when I was a furry was that a furry I knew was going on a tirade about "them heteros are invading our gay fandom and taking it away from us" and he was also ranting about how he thought all straight people, white people, christians and so forth he believed should be rounded up and shoot in the back, their children and toddlers too.

The breaking point for me being a brony while not as severe was still annoying; the brony friend I had was a outright asshole about the show.  He literally had a twilight sparkle dakimaru and was going around calling people not a "true" brony if twilight wasn't their "waifu".  The point at which I said, "fuck it" and left was with season 3 and how I didn't think it was as good as season 2; he just straight up told me to fuck off so that's exactly what I did I fucked off from the fandom.

Before you ask no I'm not going to go any furcons or bronycons; nor am I going to rejoin furaffinity or such.  Once in a while I'll add a artist to my watch list or read a fanfic or something, but hell no I'm not going to use equestria daily or such cause I've realized if you actually aren't all that interested in a fandom it's best you occasionally observe it from a distance instead otherwise you're going to wind up hating it again.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5387f439636872450d030400#post_5387f439636872450d030400
Oh I totally agree here; I was mainly being sarcastic though in describing how people that describe themselves as "hardcore fans" actually behave.  If someone describes themselves as a "hardcore fan" then chances are you're going to have a bad time when you actually want to talk about aspects they don't like.

Most of the time when someone uses the word "hardcore" to describe their level of involvement in a fandom or such the actual words they're looking for is "batshit crazy".
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body: Have you ever been in a situation where you know what you are saying is very important and you can't mess up what you are saying so the whole time you are thinking to yourself what not to say and your mind is teasing you with things that you know you should not say? For example, you are at a job interview and nervous as it is, when you are expected to talk clearly and calmly you try your best to say what you have to say while at the same time you are thinking of the worst possible things to say like "you fat piece of trash I hope you get hit by a bus" Or you see pictures of the bosses family and you think to yourself "What worthless pathetic losers, look at the nasty looking kid with his braces and bad haircut and look at that slut wife of his, what back alley did he find her in?" Basically when you are on the spot and know you can't mess up you get super nervous and try really hard not to say anything bad but at the same time you are so nervous you feel you are going to any second. That's one reason why I have been afraid of public speaking, if you accidentally swear you are out of a job.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

Speaking of. Since when does "Enjoying the best aspects of a media you feel passionate about and analyzing and deconstructing it's core elements with other people like you" translate into "Proof you're not different than the average person in your desire to exclude someone and thinking you're entitled to say when something is or not worthy of enjoying it in a different way than you"?
